current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish requirements with respect to bisphenol
		  A.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
BPA in Food Packaging Right to Know
			 Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Requirements with
			 respect to bisphenol A

Regulation of
			 containers composed of bisphenol A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (referred to in this Act as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary of Health and Human
			 Services

term.#tail:
) shall issue a
			 revised safety assessment for food containers composed, in whole or in part, of
			 bisphenol A, taking into consideration different types of such food containers
			 and the use of such food containers with respect to different foods, as
			 appropriate.

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days
			 after the date of enactment of this Act, the

header.#text:
Safety
			 assessment of products composed of BPA

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and taking into consideration the requirements of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: BPA in Food Packaging Right to Know Act/s:2/ss:a/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall determine whether
			 there is a reasonable certainty that no harm will result from aggregate
			 exposure to bisphenol A through food containers or other items composed, in
			 whole or in part, of bisphenol A, taking into consideration potential adverse
			 effects from low dose exposure, and the effects of exposure on vulnerable
			 populations, including pregnant women, infants, children, the elderly, and
			 populations with high exposure to bisphenol A.

text.#text: Through the safety assessment described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and section 170.3(i) of
			 title 21, Code of Federal Regulations, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 409 of the
			 
                Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:409

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall use the
			 safety standard described under

to evaluate the proposed uses of
			 alternatives to bisphenol A.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: BPA in Food Packaging Right to Know Act/s:2/ss:a/p:2

header.#text:
Application of
			 safety standard to alternatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 403 of the 
                Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:403

quote.#text:
This food packaging contains BPA, an
				endocrine-disrupting
				chemical.

text.#text:
If its container
				is composed, in whole or in part, of bisphenol A, unless the label includes the
				following statement:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall take effect 180
			 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: BPA in Food Packaging Right to Know Act/s:2/ss:b/p:1

text.#text:
Nothing in this
			 section (or the amendments made by this section) shall affect the right of a
			 State, political subdivision of a State, or Indian Tribe to adopt or enforce
			 any regulation, requirement, liability, or standard of performance that is more
			 stringent than a regulation, requirement, liability, or standard of performance
			 under this section or that—

applies to a
			 product category not described in this section; or

requires the
			 provision of a warning of risk, illness, or injury associated with the use of
			 food containers composed, in whole or in part, of bisphenol A.

term.#tail: includes the lining of a container; and
has the meaning given that term in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 201 of the 
                Federal
			 Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:201
